intro: Parathyrium unifurcatum, commonly known as the single-branch parathyrium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a preference for moist, woodland habitats. It is often found in shaded areas with rich, organic soil.
